Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: swift

Arguments.Name: -access-notes-path
Arguments.Description: Specify YAML file to override attributes on Swift declarations in this module

Arguments.Name: -async-main
Arguments.Description: Resolve main function as if it were called from an asynchronous context

Arguments.Name: -clang-target
Arguments.Description: Separately set the target we should use for internal Clang instance

Arguments.Name: -continue-building-after-errors
Arguments.Description: Continue building, even after errors are encountered

Arguments.Name: -coverage-prefix-map
Arguments.Description: Remap source paths in coverage info

Arguments.Name: -debug-info-format
Arguments.Description: Specify the debug info format type

Arguments.Name: -debug-info-store-invocation
Arguments.Description: Emit the compiler invocation in the debug info

Arguments.Name: -debug-prefix-map
Arguments.Description: Remap source paths in debug info

Arguments.Name: -diagnostic-style
Arguments.Description: The formatting style used when printing diagnostics

Arguments.Name: -disable-actor-data-race-checks
Arguments.Description: Disable runtime checks for actor data races

Arguments.Name: -disable-autolinking-runtime-compatibility-concurrency
Arguments.Description: Do not use autolinking for the concurrency runtime compatibility library

Arguments.Name: -disable-autolinking-runtime-compatibility-dynamic-replacements
Arguments.Description: Do not use autolinking for the dynamic replacement runtime compatibility library

Arguments.Name: -disable-autolinking-runtime-compatibility
Arguments.Description: Do not use autolinking for runtime compatibility libraries

Arguments.Name: -disable-clang-target
Arguments.Description: Disable a separately specified target triple for Clang instance to use

Arguments.Name: -disable-incremental-imports
Arguments.Description: Disable cross-module incremental build metadata and driver scheduling for Swift modules

Arguments.Name: -disable-only-one-dependency-file
Arguments.Description: Disables incremental build optimization that only produces one dependencies file

Arguments.Name: D
Arguments.Description: Marks a conditional compilation flag as true

Arguments.Name: -embed-tbd-for-module
Arguments.Description: Embed symbols from the module in the emitted tbd file

Arguments.Name: -enable-actor-data-race-checks
Arguments.Description: Emit runtime checks for actor data races

Arguments.Name: -enable-bare-slash-regex
Arguments.Description: Enable the use of forward slash regular-expression literal syntax

Arguments.Name: -enable-experimental-cxx-interop
Arguments.Description: Allow importing C++ modules into Swift (experimental feature)

Arguments.Name: -enable-incremental-imports
Arguments.Description: Enable cross-module incremental build metadata and driver scheduling for Swift modules

Arguments.Name: -enable-library-evolution
Arguments.Description: Build the module to allow binary-compatible library evolution

Arguments.Name: -enable-only-one-dependency-file
Arguments.Description: Enables incremental build optimization that only produces one dependencies file

Arguments.Name: -experimental-cxx-stdlib
Arguments.Description: C++ standard library to use; forwarded to Clang's -std lib flag

Arguments.Name: -file-compilation-dir
Arguments.Description: The compilation directory to embed in the debug info. Coverage mapping is not supported yet

Arguments.Name: -file-prefix-map
Arguments.Description: Remap source paths in debug, coverage, and index info

Arguments.Name: -framework
Arguments.Description: Specifies a framework which should be linked against

Arguments.Name: -Fsystem
Arguments.Description: Add directory to system framework search path

Arguments.Name: F
Arguments.Description: Add directory to framework search path

Arguments.Name: -gline-tables-only
Arguments.Description: Emit minimal debug info for backtraces only

Arguments.Name: g
Arguments.Description: Emit debug info. This is the preferred setting for debugging with LLDB

Arguments.Name: -index-unit-output-path
Arguments.Description: Use the specified path as the output path in the produced index data

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Add directory to the import search path

Arguments.Name: j
Arguments.Description: Number of commands to execute in parallel

Arguments.Name: -libc
Arguments.Description: The libc runtime library to use

Arguments.Name: -locale
Arguments.Description: Choose a language for diagnostic messages

Arguments.Name: -localization-path
Arguments.Description: Path to localized diagnostic messages directory

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: Add directory to library link search path

Arguments.Name: l
Arguments.Description: Specifies a library which should be linked against

Arguments.Name: -module-abi-name
Arguments.Description: ABI name to use for the contents of this module

Arguments.Name: -module-alias
Arguments.Description: If a source file imports or references module <alias_name>, the <underlying_name> is used for the contents of the file

Arguments.Name: -module-cache-path
Arguments.Description: Specifies the Clang module cache path

Arguments.Name: -module-link-name
Arguments.Description: Library to link against when using this module

Arguments.Name: -module-name
Arguments.Description: Name of the module to build

Arguments.Name: -no-color-diagnostics
Arguments.Description: Do not print diagnostics in color

Arguments.Name: -nostdimport
Arguments.Description: Don't search the standard library import path for modules

Arguments.Name: -num-threads
Arguments.Description: Enable multi-threading and specify number of threads

Arguments.Name: -Osize
Arguments.Description: Compile with optimizations and target small code size

Arguments.Name: -Ounchecked
Arguments.Description: Compile with optimizations and remove runtime safety checks

Arguments.Name: -prefix-serialized-debugging-options
Arguments.Description: Apply debug prefix mappings to serialized debug info in Swiftmodule files

Arguments.Name: -print-educational-notes
Arguments.Description: Include educational notes in printed diagnostic output, if available

Arguments.Name: -print-target-info
Arguments.Description: Print target information for the given target <triple>, such as x86_64-apple-macos10.9

Arguments.Name: -Rcross-import
Arguments.Description: Emit a remark if a cross-import of a module is triggered

Arguments.Name: -requirement-machine-abstract-signatures
Arguments.Description: Control usage of experimental generic signature minimization

Arguments.Name: -requirement-machine-inferred-signatures
Arguments.Description: Control usage of experimental generic signature minimization

Arguments.Name: -requirement-machine-protocol-signatures
Arguments.Description: Control usage of experimental protocol requirement signature minimization

Arguments.Name: -Rmodule-loading
Arguments.Description: Emit a remark and file path of each loaded module

Arguments.Name: -Rpass-missed
Arguments.Description: Report missed transformations by optimization passes whose name matches the given POSIX regular expression

Arguments.Name: -Rpass
Arguments.Description: Report performed transformations by optimization passes whose name matches the given POSIX regular expression

Arguments.Name: -runtime-compatibility-version
Arguments.Description: Link compatibility library for Swift runtime version, or 'none'

Arguments.Name: -save-optimization-record-passes
Arguments.Description: Only include passes which match a specified regular expression in the generated optimization record (by default, include all passes)

Arguments.Name: -save-optimization-record-path
Arguments.Description: Specify the file name of any generated optimization record

Arguments.Name: -save-optimization-record
Arguments.Description: Generate an optimization record file in a specific format

Arguments.Name: -save-optimization-record
Arguments.Description: Generate a YAML optimization record file

Arguments.Name: -static-stdlib
Arguments.Description: Statically link the Swift standard library

Arguments.Name: -strict-concurrency
Arguments.Description: Specify the how strict concurrency checking will be

Arguments.Name: -swift-version
Arguments.Description: Interpret input according to a specific Swift language version number

Arguments.Name: -target-cpu
Arguments.Description: Generate code for a particular CPU variant

Arguments.Name: -target-min-inlining-version
Arguments.Description: Require inlinable code with no '@available' attribute to back-deploy to this version of the '-target' OS

Arguments.Name: -target-variant
Arguments.Description: Generate 'zippered' code for macCatalyst that can run on the specified variant target triple in addition to the main -target triple

Arguments.Name: -target
Arguments.Description: Generate code for the given target <triple>, such as x86_64-apple-macos10.9

Arguments.Name: -use-ld
Arguments.Description: Specifies the linker to be used

Arguments.Name: -user-module-version
Arguments.Description: Module version specified from Swift module authors

Arguments.Name: -vfsoverlay
Arguments.Description: Add directory to VFS overlay file

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Show commands to run and use verbose output

Arguments.Name: -warn-concurrency
Arguments.Description: Warn about code that is unsafe according to the Swift Concurrency model and will become ill-formed in a future language version

Arguments.Name: -warn-implicit-overrides
Arguments.Description: Warn about implicit overrides of protocol members

Arguments.Name: -warn-swift3-objc-inference-complete
Arguments.Description: Warn about deprecated @objc inference in Swift 3 for every declaration that will no longer be inferred as @objc in Swift 4

Arguments.Name: -warn-swift3-objc-inference-minimal
Arguments.Description: Warn about deprecated @objc inference in Swift 3 based on direct uses of the Objective-C entrypoint

Arguments.Name: -working-directory
Arguments.Description: Resolve file paths relative to the specified directory

Arguments.Name: -Xlinker
Arguments.Description: Specifies an option which should be passed to the linker

Arguments.Name: --build-tests
Arguments.Description: Build both source and test targets

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Build and run an executable product

Arguments.Name: --build-tests
Arguments.Description: Build both source and test targets

Arguments.Name: --repl
Arguments.Description: Launch Swift REPL for the package

Arguments.Name: --num-workers
Arguments.Description: Number of tests to execute in parallel

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Lists test methods in specifier format

Arguments.Name: --show-codecov-path
Arguments.Description: Print the path of the exported code coverage JSON file

Arguments.Name: --filter
Arguments.Description: Run test cases matching regular expression

Arguments.Name: --skip
Arguments.Description: Skip test cases matching regular expression

Arguments.Name: --xunit-output
Arguments.Description: Path where the xUnit xml file should be generated

Arguments.Name: -Xcc
Arguments.Description: Pass a flag through to all C compiler invocations

Arguments.Name: -Xswiftc
Arguments.Description: Pass a flag through to all Swift compiler invocations

Arguments.Name: -Xlinker
Arguments.Description: Pass a flag through to all linker invocations

Arguments.Name: --enable-repository-cache
Arguments.Description: Enable the use of a shared cache when fetching repositories (default: enabled)

Arguments.Name: --disable-repository-cache
Arguments.Description: Disable the use of a shared cache when fetching repositories (default: enabled)

Arguments.Name: -C
Arguments.Description: The custom working directory that the tool should operate in

Arguments.Name: --package-path
Arguments.Description: Change working directory before any other operation

Arguments.Name: --multiroot-data-file
Arguments.Description: The path to the file containing multiroot package data. This is currently Xcode's workspace file

Arguments.Name: --enable-prefetching
Arguments.Description: Enable prefetching in resolver which will kick off parallel git cloning (default: enabled)

Arguments.Name: --disable-prefetching
Arguments.Description: Disable  prefetching in resolver which will kick off parallel git cloning (default: enabled)

Arguments.Name: --disable-sandbox
Arguments.Description: Disable using the sandbox when executing subprocesses

Arguments.Name: --destination
Arguments.Description: Path to the compilation destination describing JSON file

Arguments.Name: --sdk
Arguments.Description: Path to the compilation destination's SDK

Arguments.Name: --toolchain
Arguments.Description: Path to the compilation destination's toolchain

Arguments.Name: --no-static-swift-stdlib
Arguments.Description: Don't link Swift stdlib statically (default: false)

Arguments.Name: --skip-update
Arguments.Description: Skip updating dependencies from their remote during a resolution

Arguments.Name: --sanitize
Arguments.Description: Turn on runtime checks for erroneous behavior

Arguments.Name: --force-resolved-versions
Arguments.Description: Only use versions from the Package.resolved file and fail resolution if it is out-of-date

Arguments.Name: --auto-index-store
Arguments.Description: Enable or disable indexing-while-building feature (default: auto)

Arguments.Name: --enable-parseable-module-interfaces
Arguments.Description: Whether to enable generation of `.swiftinterface`s alongside `.swiftmodule`s

Arguments.Name: --trace-resolver
Arguments.Description: Write dependency resolver trace to a file

Arguments.Name: -j
Arguments.Description: The number of jobs to spawn in parallel during the build process

Arguments.Name: --enable-build-manifest-caching
Arguments.Description: Whether to enable llbuild manifest caching (default: enabled)

Arguments.Name: --disable-build-manifest-caching
Arguments.Description: Whether to disable llbuild manifest caching (default: enabled)

Arguments.Name: --emit-swift-module-separately
Arguments.Description: Emit the Swift module separately from the object files

Arguments.Name: --use-integrated-swift-driver
Arguments.Description: Whether to use the integrated Swift driver rather than shelling out to a separate process

Arguments.Name: --experimental-explicit-module-build
Arguments.Description: Whether to use the explicit module build flow (with the integrated driver)

Arguments.Name: --print-manifest-job-graph
Arguments.Description: Write the command graph for the build manifest as a graphviz file

Arguments.Name: --build-system
Arguments.Description: The build system to use (default: native)

Arguments.Name: --netrc
Arguments.Description: Whether to load .netrc files for authenticating with remote servers when downloading binary artifacts or communicating with a registry

Arguments.Name: --netrc-file
Arguments.Description: The path to the .netrc file used when `netrc` is `true`

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Display the list of dependencies that can be updated

Arguments.Name: experimental-api-diff
Arguments.Description: Diagnose API-breaking changes to Swift modules in a package

Arguments.Name: --invert-baseline
Arguments.Description: Invert the baseline which is helpful for determining API additions

Arguments.Name: --preserve-structure
Arguments.Description: Preserve the internal structure of PIF

Arguments.Name: edit
Arguments.Description: Put a package in editable mode

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Create or use the checkout at this path

Arguments.Name: unedit
Arguments.Description: Remove a package from editable mode

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Unedit the package even if it has uncommitted and unpushed changes

Arguments.Name: set-mirror
Arguments.Description: Set a mirror for a dependency

Arguments.Name: get-mirror
Arguments.Description: Print mirror configuration for the given package dependency

Arguments.Name: tools-version
Arguments.Description: Manipulate tools version of the current package

Arguments.Name: --set-current
Arguments.Description: Set tools version of package to the current tools version in use

Arguments.Name: --set
Arguments.Description: Set tools version of package to the given value

Arguments.Name: generate-xcodeproj
Arguments.Description: Generates an Xcode project (this command will be deprecated soon)

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Path where the Xcode project should be generated

Arguments.Name: --watch
Arguments.Description: Watch for changes to the Package manifest to regenerate the Xcode project

Arguments.Name: --skip-extra-files
Arguments.Description: Do not add file references for extra files to the generated Xcode project

Arguments.Name: compute-checksum
Arguments.Description: Compute the checksum for a binary artifact

Arguments.Name: archive-source
Arguments.Description: Create a source archive for the package

Arguments.Name: -o
Arguments.Description: The absolute or relative path for the generated source archive
